titleStmt.title: Herman Hadlan v. D.M Brown. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Herman Hadlan v. D.M. Brown. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court of the Second Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Olympia
In the matter of the application of Herman Hadlan for a writ of attachment
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
Herman Hadlan being forth duly sworn deposes and says I am the Herman Hadlan named in this proceedings

That on the 25th day of June 1884 and before I was arrested as resited in the committment I appealed to the City Counsil of the City of Olympia for a to do in said City in keeping a two hall that I at said time at a regular meeting of the said Counsil I presented a bond petition, of properly holds certificate of moral character and the necessary money for a lisence for six months, am fully compliant with the Ordinance No 149 of said City in petition for such lisence
That said City Counsil named no objection to the same only that it was not a compliance with Ordinance 191 of said City and hold the matter sum for raw meed
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 2nd day of July 1884 G.C. Israel Notary Public
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
G.C. Israel being first duly sworn says that he knows from the statement of ten of the City Counsil and the City Clerk that the foregoing affidavit is true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 2nd day of July 1884 R.S. O'Bruin Clerk
